originalText.text: Maria was such a pleasure to work with. I have a 1 year old Cockapoo, but if you ask him he would say he's a Defender of Mom. She has an ease and patience to her approach that my pup was able to drop the skepticism and really work with Maria's guidance. Logistics-wise, she was also fantastic to coordinate with which helped a lot & always on time.

originalText.text:
Uptown Doggy is THE dog trainer to go to. We adopted Wes, a rescue chug (chihuahua x pug) with a bit of anxiety and bad manners you might expect from a stray, like lunging, hoarding, eating expensive Apple electronics, climbing on the table, and more. We were especially concerned about some occasional snaps at our eight-year. With Maria's expertise, Wes became calm and civilized, not only in our home but also in overwhelming social situations. Maria's easygoing demeanor and clever techniques helped with every aspect of his behavior. The difference has been extraordinary. She also helped with leash training - now he walks next to us rather than pulling, and she even taught Wes how to calm himself. What's most remarkable is that her techniques are loving and gentle, which helped us bond with Wes while training him. Wes would get VERY excited every time Maria came back for another session! Finally, Maria gave us lots of supporting information so that we could continue to reinforce the training ourselves.
And regarding our eight-year-old, Wes happily cuddles with him all the time now. No more lunging or snapping. Thank you, Uptown Doggy!

originalText.text: We have a yellow lab who is now 9 months old.  He is a very big puppy and is going to be a large and powerful dog.  We wanted to get training, for him and us, so he would learn to be a good dog that we could control with commands.  Maria's methods are gentle and effective.  We have a happy, friendly pup and we know how to communicate with him.  Everyone is happy.  Maria's training was life-changing for us.

originalText.text: We recently finished our first round of training with Maria and I could not recommend her more! We’ve got Bella, a 80lb pit/dogo mix with endless energy. Maria’s training has helped so much with teaching Bella calming techniques, relaxation techniques, and gettin her to be more attentive to us in busy public situations. We’ve already seen so many benefits of the training at the park, dog parks, at the vet, and when company comes over. We will be continuing are training with Maria, and I hope you do too!

originalText.text: This is the Lockpicking Lawyer and what I have for you today is an IMC brand Titan battery cover lock. This is a relatively new product on the frontier, but unfortunately for the Legion main I'm currently rodeoing it has several glaring flaws. The core itself is one of them, in order to pick it I am going to use this dataknife Bosnian Bill and I made. Little click on one, nothing on 2, click on 3, back to 1, 1 is set, little counterrotation on 2 and we've got it open. I would do that again to show you it wasn't a fluke, but there is actually a much faster way to open this lock than single pin picking. I am going insert a thin shim of metal I cut from a stim energy drink can and insert it alongside the shackle, just on the inside here. That will push aside the single locking lug and we've got it ope. One more time to show you it wasn't a fluke. As you can see this lock offers about as much protection as the avergae masterlock and should absolutely not be used to secure expensive military hardware. That's all I have for you today if you have any questions or comments please put them below. if you like this video and would like to see more like it please subscribe and as always have a nice day. Thank you.

text.text: This is the Lockpicking Lawyer and what I have for you today is an IMC brand Titan battery cover lock. This is a relatively new product on the frontier, but unfortunately for the Legion main I'm currently rodeoing it has several glaring flaws. The core itself is one of them, in order to pick it I am going to use this dataknife Bosnian Bill and I made. Little click on one, nothing on 2, click on 3, back to 1, 1 is set, little counterrotation on 2 and we've got it open. I would do that again to show you it wasn't a fluke, but there is actually a much faster way to open this lock than single pin picking. I am going insert a thin shim of metal I cut from a stim energy drink can and insert it alongside the shackle, just on the inside here. That will push aside the single locking lug and we've got it ope. One more time to show you it wasn't a fluke. As you can see this lock offers about as much protection as the avergae masterlock and should absolutely not be used to secure expensive military hardware. That's all I have for you today if you have any questions or comments please put them below. if you like this video and would like to see more like it please subscribe and as always have a nice day. Thank you.
